Drax module

class drax.Drax(params: DraxProjectParameters)[source]

Bases: object

This is a class representation of Drax platform which must be used by third part application for accessing Drax IoT functionalities and services.

Parameters

params (class:DraxParameters) – setting parameters for Drax SDK

addConfigurationListener(topic: str, listeners: list[draxsdk.consumer.listeners.listener.Listener])[source]

This method is called to attach a configuration listener to an IoT node. The listener will be listening to a specific topic on a queue of the AMQP Drax Message Broker. The queue is set to buffer configuration messages coming from Drax Cloud platform or third part application and directed to the node. It is possibile to attach more that one listener for a single topic.

This function can be called on a device (node, i.e. sensor or gateway) that will be waiting for configuration commands waiting on AMQP Drax Message Broker queue coming from Drax Cloud platforma .

Parameters

  • topic (str) – topic to be listening to

  • listeners (ListenersList, [Listener]) – list of Listeners objects

addStateListener(topic: str, listeners: list[draxsdk.consumer.listeners.listener.Listener])[source]

Add a node state listener in order to get information published by nodes in a queue defined by a specific topic on AMQP Drax Message Broker. The queue is set to buffer state messages coming from IoT nodes and directed to Drax Cloud platform. It is possibile to attach more that one listener for a single topic. This function can be called from a third part application or internal Drax module that will be waiting for stated sent by nodes. It returns nothing; it start the receiver service.

Parameters

  • topic (str) – Topic where the node publishes the message

  • listeners (Listener[]) – list of listeners objects waiting for node’s message

getNodeById(nodeId: int) → dict[source]

Returns node information given its code ID, making an HTTP GET Rest call to DraxCloud. The client must have been initialized with project ApiKey and ApiSecret in request headers.

Parameters

nodeId (int) – project unique code ID

Returns

node information

Return type

dict

handshake(node: dict)[source]

@TBC

Parameters

node (dict) – _description_

listNodes(projectId: int, keyword='', pagingState='') → dict[source]

Returns information about all nodes part of a project, making an HTTP GET Rest call to DraxCloud. The client must have been initialized with project ApiKey and ApiSecret in request headers.

Parameters

projectId (str) – project unique code ID

Returns

dict of nodes information (JSON format)

Return type

dict

listNodesStates(projectId: str, nodeIds: list[int], fromTimeMillis: int, toTimeMillis: int)[source]

This method can be called by a third part application to Drax Cloud platform in order to get the states of multiple nodes part of a project (selected by their IDs) relative to a time interval set by timestamps limits expressed in millisecs. The communication is direct, it uses an HTTPs POST request to Drax Cloud platform REST API service. Source: Application (third-part) or internal Drax module Comunication protocol: HTTPs Destination (final): Drax Cloud platform (REST API service)

Parameters

  • projectId (str) – Project Identifier

  • nodeIds (list[int]) – list of IoT nodes’ identifiers

  • fromTimeMillis (int) – initial time (millis)

  • toTimeMillis (int) – final time (millis)

Returns

dict of nodes’ states in time interval

Return type

dict

listStates(projectId: str, nodeId: int, fromTimeMillis: int, toTimeMillis: int) → dict[source]

This method can be called by a third part application or internal Drax module to Drax Cloud platform in order to get the states of a single node part of a project (selected by their IDs) relative to a time interval set by timestamps limits expressed in millisecs. The communication is direct, it uses an HTTPs POST request to Drax Cloud platform REST API service. Source: Application (third-part) or internal Drax module Comunication protocol: HTTPs Destination (final): Drax Cloud platform (REST API service)

Parameters

  • projectId (str) – Project Identifier

  • nodeId (int) – IoT node identifier

  • fromTimeMillis (int) – initial time (millis)

  • toTimeMillis (int) – final time (millis)

Returns

dict of node’s states in time interval

Return type

dict

setConfiguration(nodeId: int, urn: str, configuration: dict, cryptographyDisabled=False)[source]

This method is called by Drax Cloud platform to send a configuration (command) to one node part of Drax Iot network. The communication is not direct, but it uses AMQP Drax Message Broker. Source: Drax Cloud platform Comunication protocol: AMQP queue selected on a specific topic Destination (intermediate): Drax Message Broker Destination (final): IoT node This function can be called by third part application or internal Drax module to send a configuration command to an IoT node of the network.

Parameters

  • nodeId (int) – IoT node identifier (receiver)

  • urn (str) – URN

  • configuration (dict) – configuration to be sent to the node

  • cryptographyDisabled (bool, optional) – flag to control ECDH cryptografy on data, defaults to False

setState(nodeId: int, urn: str, state: dict, cryptographyDisabled=False)[source]

This method is called by the node or the gateway, which the node is connected to, in order to comunicate its state to Drax Cloud platform. Source: IoT node / gateway Comunication protocol: AMQP queue selected on a specific topic Destination (intermediate): Drax Message Broker Destination (final): Drax Cloud platform This function is used by sensors.

Parameters

  • nodeId (int) – IoT node identifier (sender)

  • urn (str) – URN

  • state (dict) – state to be sent to Drax cloud

  • cryptographyDisabled (bool, optional) – flag to control ECDH cryptografy on data, defaults to False

start()[source]

Start the drax instance: it connects Drax SDK to Drax AMQP message Broker.

stop()[source]

Stop the drax instance: it disconnects Drax SDK from Drax AMQP message Broker.

drax.loadConfigFromFile(paramsFile: str) → DraxServerConfig[source]

Loads Drax Server configuration parameter from JSON file to DraxServerConfig object.

Parameters

paramsFile (str) – path (abs or relative) to the JSON file

Returns

Drax Server configuration object to be used to initialize Drax / DraxClient

Return type

DraxServerConfig
